availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Daniel (Caldwell County, KY, private 48th KY Inf USA)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, soldier. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and hospital attendant from October 26, 1863, to December 18, 1864. Captured by C.S.A. forces and parolled at Eddyville, Kentucky, on October 13, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 444.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 477.
